reviews.review_msg: She is a knowledgeable prof, but can be very stern, sarcastic, and easily ticked off. She sometimes comes off condescending when you visit her to ask questions. She has a very strict policy for her students although she is pretty generous when it comes to her own petty mistakes. I recommend her to treat students as people instead of nuisance :)

I've had two amazing chemistry professors at SFU. Dr. Neil Branda and Dr. Robert Britton- they are tough graders but they teach the concepts well and their grading is fair.  Good luck getting through this course with a smile. If you're a chem major she will make you want to major in art. Do not take this with her.  You have been warned!!!

She is an extremely capable prof. I really enjoyed her lectures and she is actually a very nice person. Knowing CHEM 281 is important for this course. So if you get her you will be fine. She is really good. :) Good Luck!
Very clear about material for this course. Calculations asked in final was taught in lecture. Easy to follow. She's also scary and intimidating to approach.
Very serious professor, seems to be very busy. Her class is hard, a lot of material to cover. Exams are difficult. She explains things well but quickly.

Her accent is terrible for understanding exactly what she's talking about.  Exams are long and extremely tough.  That aside, she clearly loves what she does and isn't afraid to show that. Would not take again.
genuine

Shes a pretty good prof. Her notes are ok. Cant stress it enough but its organic chemistry. Its not meant to be a breeze. As long as you practice drawing the structures and understand the trend it isn't that hard. You will fail if you skip and don't study because its mostly drawing molecule structure language on the exam, not english memorization.

Lectures provide very clear explanations of the material. Do not count on notes being helpful, you must use your textbook. The material covered on the exams are fair, however, the questions can be difficult and it is challenging to get a good grade. Even if you understand material, you need extensive practice. LOTS OF PRACTICE. Overall, not bad.
She's a hard marker in my opinion. Read the text and co-relate it to the notes since the notes alone won't be enough >.>

O chem is a really hard subject so be prepared to put effort in. Lectures are a MUST. The notes she posts are only a few slides, she elaborates WAY more in lecture. Her exams are fair, a bit on the hard side and a bit long. Practice! Only thing I didnt like was that her office hours were always packed so sometimes tough to get proper help.
Her exams were tough and marking was unfair. Her notes were next to useless, as they has almost no information on them.
Peggy is a great prof who is passionate about what she teaches. If you aren't going to pay attention or try hard then don't expect to have a good time or get a good mark. I hope to have her again.
This prof is pretty terrible.  She is incredibly hard to understand.  Her notes are short and don't help at all, and she never seems to be around for help.
She is helpful and make sure you do the tutorial assignments every week, all the questions in her exam are directly taken from there.
Makes O-chem even harder for students.

If you read the comments below, you will see that the trend is that Dr. Peggy is a great prof, the course is very heavy and requires a lot of studying every week. She delivers it like it is. No surprises. You study and know the problem sets well and you will get a good mark. Shes very approachable and is available when needed.
Peggy is a great prof, funny too. The problem is the course is quite challenging. Do the tutorial problems, read the textbook, and keep up in class or you'll fall behind.
Hard ass final. Gotta know your stuff. Teaches the material as if it were easy to comprehend, but that's because she's a researcher, not a professor first.

This course is no walk in the park and you need to keep up or fear falling behind. However, Peggy is an awesome prof and I would definitely recommend her! The midterm was easy but the final is challenging. Practice practice PRACTICE! Read the textbook and notes! Overall, she is an excellent prof! I'm not sure why some students don't like her...

There is no prof equal to even half of what Dr P is. She is the only prof so far who made chem fun! The midterm was a joke, but the final was quite difficult if you don't challenge yourself when you study. Read the lectures, do questions in the textbook, do tutorial questions. Practice makes perfect. Overall, excellent prof, excellent course.

I think she is a nice prof. Her notes are very organized almost like textbook!!! However, the course is a ball breaker but she helps the students to understand the material well and if you keep up you should get away with a C+.
Good

As helpful as she can be, it's always a challenge to go and see her, I know I went to see her once because I had trouble with a few reactions and she made me feel stupid, and kept saying if you read the notes it's all there, well I obviously read the notes and that's why I came to see you, because I didn't understand, good prof though
Really good. I think people do bad cause it's a hard class and blame the prof. She's always got office hours and very fair exams wit fair marking.

The final was actually very hard, but if you study, you will do well, I can see why majority of people were freaked out by the final afterward, but study hard and you will pass hopefully. Chem 282 is not an easy course, and the final was definitely harder than the midterm. If you don't understand the concepts, you will mess up on the final
she is really nice and a very good lecturer. she's always willing to help and her final was really easy! if you study the notes and problem sets you will do well in this class! :)

She is a very good lecturer and explains concepts very well. She is always available for extra help but she expects you to study hard. Her exams are a bit on the hard side but overall she is a very nice woman.

Great prof.  Made us write out our notes by hand, which I thought would be terrible, but ended being much easier to follow the material.  She also TAed my tutorial and was great, going through every question we asked (even stupid ones!).  She was also available during office hours to answer questions and there usually was a small mob.  Got an A+.

So my far my worst post secondary experience in a class in the last 4 years. I had to hold back from verbally defending other students who were being berated, knowing my mark would be affected. After the first midterm avg. 42% we were asked what was wrong with us, because everything was clear. Avoid this prof in all future en devours.
I personally like the professor, the midterm is fair. Lectures are recommended since she goes over her slides in details.

Four of my friends had their laptops open in her class and were minding their own business. All of a sudden, the prof stops, walks over, and openly says: "You four, get out...". They were not disrupting class in any way.

I personally liked her, she was nice to me, I definitely felt comfortable around her. She never yelled at anyone as far as I know, if she caught students doing something crazy, yea she would call them out, but never in a disrespectful way. She is serious but she has to be Otherwise students will walk all over her She has no tolerance for immaturity

There are always two ways to get your message across and she always chooses the wrong way. VERY condescending and needs to learn to show some respect for even the "non-genius" students; heaven forbid if you make a mistake! Basically I'm paying to be in the class so she can get a high off offending me. If I didn't like Chem before, I hate it now..

Very bad experience with this prof. I sawin class hostility, verbal abuse and the creation of an atmosphere that clearly discouraged questions. Hard to hold my tongue during tutorials with this treatment of students, so I stopped going. Never considered going to her office hours, and she blamed us for the 36% mt avg. Turned me off the entire dept.

She is a nice woman outside of class, with a nice smile, but I did not enjoy this class very much.  The exams are very hard, and not similar to the difficulty that we were accustomed to with problem sets.  This class does not inspire me to continue on in chemistry.  Nice woman, but I think she should remember that her students are not chemists.

I silently enjoy it when she frightens students. First midterm was fair, avg. 58% but the 2nd midterm was very unfair imo. Class avg. 36%!!! Blamed US for doing bad on the 2nd midterm, but there is no excuse for 36% avg. The very few people who did good could have been repeating the course. 90% of the material is self taught.

Her lecture notes are great.  I never bought the text book and everything you need is explained entirely in the notes.  Do her tutorial study questions, she re-uses them on midterms and finals.  When you email her though make sure you say Dr. Paduraru...
i just wrote the final yesterday and it wasn't too bad. Her midterms are not hard. As a person, she's nice. As a teacher, she's not very clear.
her thick accent makes it hard to understand her! and her lectures aren't very productive... haha but you'll think she's kinda funny if you don't take her rude comments so seriously.
her multiple choice midterms are easy..kinda difficult to understand b/c of accent.. as a person, she's  nice..

She's actually not too bad. If you just accept her attitude, you'll see that she's a genuinely nice person! I promise.           But like every other instructor, she wants her students to study hard. BTW, so far her exams have been fairly easy(midterms I and II)!

OMG,had her for a sub once for 286 and she was a monster.She yelled at me 3 times that day when everything i did had no meaning to offend anyone.Attitude rlly stinks &coldhearted.b/c of her i have to retake 286 later.She treats ppl in chem department nicely but towards students shes a devil with 2 horns sticking out.If u r wise, avoid this prof!!!

Overall, I think she was a good prof...sure she is a bit intimidating, but I thought her exams were completely fair if you studied and kept up with assignments throughout the semester...It is however impossible to get a good mark in her class unless you enjoy self-teaching.

Like all Science courses, you gotta work hard for a good mark. She was tough as in she gave hard exams. The lectures felt rushed, especially the last sections. The TAs did a good job of explaining the concepts, though. Would not recommend unless you're the self-motivated type prepared to work very hard.

Don't take her unless your life depends on it. Her overall teaching is alright but her attitude towards her students is really poor. One of those profs who ruins your life forever. Exams are unfair as stated before, who puts a 5part question worth 19 marks on a final exam worth 100? Really mean, not approachable for help at all. try not to have her

Her final was THE most horrible exam I've ever taken at SFU.  Although it wasnt really cumulative, but it still was terrible.  She puts a 19 point question with 5 parts?! Such that if u screw up the first part, there goes the rest of your marks for the question.  She obviously is horrible at making exams...do not take this prof for anything!

This person is truly evil. Moody and condescending. Why does SFU hire people like this from within the department? I'm not even talking about her knowledge or ability. I'm talking about her attitude. She is a bad person. Obviously she gets a power-trip being in a position of authority. But reality check your a sessional instructor. Not impressed!

She is definitely one of the worst profs ever in SFU, her notes are 100% straight off the book, and they're just mostly straight up drawings.  Instead I find reading the book was more useful. Not only is she "hostile", but her teaching is so horrible that the class averages for the MTs were extremely low. Would not recommend taking this prof.
She's alright. She knows her stuff but wasn't really there to help out with the labs since she was teaching chem 286 at the same time.
one of the worst profs. i've ever had. no matter what your question is, she will always give u the "r u stupid?" look. doesn't show any respect to students.
I find this prof very hostile.she treats people like they've committed sin.
Not very helpful, seems grumpy when asked questions or instructions for lab. The final was geared towards memorizing the procedures of individual experiments.
unlike 281, practice problems were no help
